intro: Papuahoya, commonly known as the "Cape York hibiscus," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia and Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color, and it has palmately lobed leaves. Papuahoya thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rainforest habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native environment.
